item.description:
PLEASE -- TAKE A FEW MINUTES AND REVIEW ALL THE TRIP DETAILS BELOW. By signing up you have agreed to our GROUP GUIDELINES.


EVENT ORGANIZER:
Julie Moran Contact me here: jmmoran @ nycap.rr.com, Mobile 281-5882.





ESSENTIAL TRIP DETAILS:

Difficulty: About 10.5 miles, about 3,900 Feet total vertical climb. At 1.5 miles / hour, this is about a seven-hour hike.

Google Maps Trailhead Directions, Distances (link) from the Skylight Pond Trailhead on Kirby Road / (Steam Mill Road) near Ripton, VT (THE CAR SPOT) and the Glen Trail START.

Estimated CAR SPOT arrival time (w/ no stops): 9 a.m.

Estimated Hike Start Time: 9:15 a.m.


ESSENTIALS TO BRING: Flash light AND head lamp, food / snacks / at least three bottles of water, first aid items, sunscreen, bug repellent. Trekking poles may be very helpful on this trip.





IMPORTANT UPDATES (05/19/2010 9:45 PM):
This is a cross-posted trip with Hiking Mates CHALLENGE, the Hike/Snow Shoe Vermont! group, and the 4 Seasons Hiking Group. This is the third time we've tried to complete this trip, having to reschedule owing to bad weather. Hope we can finally complete this trip! Owing to the relatively long drive time ... and the fact that I may drive up and camp the evening before .... if you are interested in going, please RSVP as soon as possible, and also contact me to confirm additional meetup details.

Allow me to introduce you New Yorkers of the wonderful Green Mountains of Vermont! They are magical, and unforgettable. This is a repost from the spring, when I visited the area alone and explored parking and trailhead details. Inside the Green Mountain National Forest, we'll spot a car on Kirby Road (USFS Route 59 / Skylight Pond Trailhead) then drive northward to the USFS Route 201 / Glen Trail Trailhead hoping to start no later than 10:00 a.m. We'll start out towards Mount Grant via the Glen Trail, hiking southward along Vermont's famous Long Trail to the other Presidentials: Mount Cleveland, Mount Roosevelt and Mount Wilson. We'll finish the range at the Bread Loaf Mountain summits descending along the Skylight Pond side trail back to Natural Turnpike. It is a very lovely area.


RESEARCH ESSENTIALS:

Mt. Grant / Mt. Cleveland:
LINK: Peakbagger
LINK: MountainZone (Mt. Grant)
LINK: MountainZone (Mt. Cleveland)

Mt. Roosevelt:
LINK: Peakbagger
LINK: MountainZone
LINK: A PHOTO TOUR

Mt. Wilson / Bread Loaf Mountain:
LINK: Peakbagger (Mt. Wilson)
LINK: Peakbagger (Bread Loaf Mountain)
LINK: SummitPost
LINK: MountainZone

CLICK HERE FOR A TOPO MAP / HIKE ROUTE.

See you there! Julie.


WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY HIKING MATES CHALLENGE EVENT.

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for the Green Honda Element ...
item.name: GREEN MOUNTAIN SERIES: The "Presidentials" of Vermont's Bread Loaf Wilderness
